items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A {@item trinket|phb} that feels familiar to you but you don't know why, a set of {@item traveler's clothes|phb}, a cloak, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 15 gp

entries.name: Overview:
entries: You recently awoke, lost, confused, and without a personal history you can remember. You have skills, and a grasp on factual information about the world around you (often to your surprise), but no real idea of who you are or where you came from.
You start with the 'Deja Vu' feature. If you later remember your former life or develop new abilities or abilities, you can choose a different background feature as apppropriate.

entries.name: Quirks and Impulses
entries: Although you have no memory, you are not a blank slate. Certain mannerisms and behaviours persist, even though you don't remember their point of origin.

rows: {@b Formal Attitude.} You speak extremely formally at all times, especially to those you see as superiors.
{@b Wanderlust.} You feel a compulsion to travel. When in one place for too long, you grow physically restless. Over time, you might choose to curb this instinct.
{@b Driven to Learn.} For some reason you are compelled to the library and colleges of the world. The urge to absorb and learn as much as you can is deeply rooted in you.
{@b Religious Thinking.} You find yourself easily convinced by religious figures and messages.
{@b Mistrusting.} Even when you have no concrete reason, you have a strong feeling that you shouldn't let your guard down around people.
{@b Physical.} You don't remember why, but you're very strong and you findd comfort in excercising your body.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Being Lost is defined by the unknown. At any moment you might stumble upon a person who recognizes you, but appears to be a total stranger. Will it be friend or foe? Suspicion and confusion are daily experiences for the Lost, and friends are hard to make and keep.

rows: I like to do something to capture the current moment, be it writing down a poem or drawing a picture.
I keep a notebook of all the things I'm supposed to know so I won't forget it.
I get constant headaches when I want to think about my past.
I come up with a new story of who I was every time I am asked.
I don't want to pay close attention to my past.
Whoever I was, I am me now. I am actually excited to start fresh.
I often hum, whistle, or play a song that I am unsure how I know. The song itself has an ill effect on those around me.
I don’t really know how the world works.
{@b Beginning.} This is a new, fresh start for me! (Any)
{@b Freedom.} No one can or should tell me who I am supposed to be. (Chaotic)
{@b Destiny.} I believe that everything happens for a reason and that all we can do is accept it. (Lawful)
{@b Ambition.} I will do whatever it takes to remember who I was. (Evil)
{@b Apathy.} Why bother searching for my past? It's in the past, after all. (Neutral)
{@b Open.} I have so much to learn. I can’t reject any opinions out of hand. (Good)
The people I am with saved me.
The trinket I possess is more valuable than life itself.
The afflicted of the world should be protected.
The home I live in right now is the only home that matters to me.
There is a place that I feel drawn or connected to.
Every time I hit a dead end in learning of my past, I mentally shut down for a bit.
I am much too quick to believe people who say they know me.
I tend to forget what I was doing.
My morals are extremely malleable.
I can’t stand when people take pity on me.
I am almost certain that what I did in the past was bad, and the guilt eats me up even though I don't know what it was.
